intro: Asperula lutea var. rigidula, commonly known as the rigid yellow woodruff, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early spring, typically from April to May. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rugged appearance. Asperula lutea var. rigidula thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and alpine environments.
